name: electricity production, oil | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4531/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity at a grid-connected oil power plant in Peru. This dataset is based on  PE dataset, "electricity production, oil, GLO" (accessed October 2014), with adjustments to the peruvian context in year 2014. The efficiency and net electricity production parameters were updated using 2014 data. The data was obtained from nineteen power plants, these are: Mollendo (5.1%), Santa Rosa (0:5%), C.T. RF Talara (20.3%), Chilina (6.4%), GD Chiclayo Oeste (0.6%), Piura (1%), TG Chimbote (0.8%), CT Dolorespata (1.8%), CTE Cachimayo (13%), Tumber MAK1 MAK2 (3.2%), CTE Tamburco (2.0%), CTE Uripipata (1.2%), Ilo Catkato (0.5%), Ilo TG (8.9%), Ilo TVs (24.7%), CT RF Planta Ilo(5.9%), Taparachi(0.4%), San Nicolás TVs (3.5%), Bellavista (0.05%). Production using oil power plants accounts only to 0.21% of the total in the country. Data was obtained from the Committee of Economic Operations of the National Interconnected System (COES), the national peruvian entity that regulates the dispatch and generation of energy from the electricity sector (COES, 2014 and MINEM, 2014). The COES publishes the statistics of operations of the National Interconnected System (SEIN) in an annual basis.  In addition, public access information was requested from the General Directorate of Environmental Energy Affairs (DGAAE) of the Ministry of Energy and Mines on Environmental Impact Studies (EIA) of the plants in operation in 2014.;For water  exchanges the dataset "electricity production, oil, PE, 1980-2015" (accessed October 2014), was used as reference ;Comments:; - sulfur content of the oil is not adapted to local/average conditions.; - CO2 emissions are presented for the combustion and for the flue gas treatment; Production volume: 87515814kWh;The efficiency of these plants has an average value of  33.15;The production represent only the 0,206 % of total energy produced in Peru;Sources:;COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, (2014). Cap. 06 PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELÉCTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/06_PRODUCCION TERMOELECTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE, CUADRO N° 6.3 CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE EN LAS CENTRALES TERMOELÉCTRICAS 2014,CUADRO N° 6.2 RENDIMIENTO PROMEDIO ANUAL - 2014.  November 14, 2017. ;MINEM, 2014. Ministerio de Energía y Minas (2014). Anuario Ejecutivo de Electricidad 2014. Dirección General de Electricidad. Retrieved online from http://www.minem.gob.pe/_estadisticaSector.php?idSector=6,  24 august 2017.    ;OSINERGMIN, 2015. Oganismo Supervisor de la Energía y Mineria. La industria de los hidrocarburos líquidos en el Perú: 20 años de aporte al desarrollo del país, pp.36 (2015 )http://www.osinergmin.gob.pe/seccion/centro_documental/Institucional/Estudios_Economicos/Libros/anexo-industria-hidrocarburos-liquidos-Peru.pdf. Retrieved online 24 august 2017.          ;EPA, 1999. US Environmental Protection Agency (1999). AP 42 -Compilation of Air Pollutant Emission Factors, Volume 1: Stationary Point and Area Sources Compilation of Air Pollutant Emission Factors, AP-42, AP 42, Fifth Edition. Fuel Oil Combustion, Final Section - Supplement E September 1999, corrected May 2010. Background Document - September 1998. https://www3.epa.gov/ttn/chief/ap42/ch01/index.html. Retrieved online 24 august 2017.

From the constructed power plant ready to produce electricity and from the fuel ready to be used.

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and arrived at the busbar.

This dataset includes all energy use, use of chemicals, emissions to air and water including treatment of flue gasses and effluents. In an oil power plant, water is needed for cooling, feed water for the steam circuit, for the flue gas treatment, or other cleaning. This dataset only considers water use (evaporation) for cooling and steam circuit.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2014.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: In Peru, the Economic Operation Committee of the National Interconnected System (COES) is divided in three operation areas, north, central and south. The power plants considered in this dataset are located in the three areas.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Electricity production in a conventional oil power plant with a capacity of 500 MWe.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Efficiency and net electricity production parameters were regionalized using the data from nineteen power plants and extrapolated from the peruvian dataset ("electricity production, oil, PE, 2008-2008" (accessed October 2014).  The fuel consumption per kWh was obtained as a weighted average of each of the plants considered and this was used to calculate the emissions of  CO2, CO, NOx, CH4, SO2 and particulate material. Emission factors of the EPA were used, as per the recommendations found in OSINERGMIN, supervisory body for energy and mining investment (OSINERGMIN, 2017).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     For water  exchanges the dataset ""electricity production, oil, PE, 2008-2008" (accessed October 2014)" was used as reference.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     The value used in this dataset is a weighted average.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Sources: Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. COES, 2014, MINEM, 2014, OSINERGMIN, 2017
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Literature, environmental reports and statistical data for nineteen power plants.
